name: OWNY
headline: Manage capital, investors & banking in one place.
description: Owny provides businesses with a turn-key portal to issue Funds, SAFEs and Notes. Your portal is fully equipped to manage investors, treasury, multi-currency accounts and ability to send and request ACH/Wire payments globally. Optional features include seamless crypto custody and solutions through Coinbase Institutional.

founders.name: Umed Latifov, Founder
founders.description: Umed has 18+ year experience in finance, private equity, banking regulation and infrastructure investments. He has a comprehensive background ranging from a startup CEO to managing multi-billion dollar energy generation, transmission and distribution projects. Most recently he was Vice Chair of Central Bank and then Vice Minister of Finance of Tajikistan where he was in charge of overhauling the countries payments infrastructure. Umed holds and MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business.

founders.name: Ola Wiberg, Founder/CTO
founders.description: Entrepreneurial product focused engineer with more than twenty years of experience leading the product development lifecycle from ideation to full production releases of a number of products ranging from hardware products, embedded software solutions, web/mobile applications, distributed systems, and cloud applications.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: OWNY**

Founded in 2019 and based in Palo Alto, California, OWNY is a cutting-edge financial technology company that forms part of Y Combinator’s S18 batch. With a lean team of 10, OWNY is focused on a singular mission: to seamlessly manage capital, investors, and banking, all under one roof.

**What They Do**

Initially starting as a platform that enables businesses to issue Funds, SAFEs, and Notes, OWNY has evolved into a comprehensive solution for managing private offerings and moving capital globally. Their portal is equipped with features that would typically require multiple services, simplifying complex financial operations. 

Here's a closer look at their offerings:

1. **Private Capital for Startups**: Startups can issue SAFE and Convertible Note instruments using tried-and-true Y Combinator templates. This makes it easier for emerging businesses to attract investment without getting bogged down in red tape.

2. **Funds Management**: Private equity and venture capital firms benefit from an end-to-end solution tailored specifically to manage fund offerings and portfolio management effectively.

3. **Real Estate Solutions**: For property owners, OWNY provides tools that allow them to manage contracts, pay insurance, and collect payments from rental properties—all in one place.

4. **Formation Services**: Entrepreneurs can start their LLC or C-corp with ease, thanks to OWNY's tools that supply tax ID setup, banking solutions, and transaction reporting.

5. **Global Payment Transfers**: OWNY features dedicated accounts that facilitate ACH, Wire, FX, and SWIFT payments, simplifying international transactions.

6. **Transaction Reporting & Data Analytics**: The platform empowers users with back-office tools for compliance and transaction management, alongside analytics that track sales activity and interests.

7. **Contract Administration**: Users can create and share agreements seamlessly, streamlining processes like closings and payments.

8. **Dedicated Support**: A specialized support team is available to assist customers and their stakeholders, ensuring smooth operations and communication.

**Tech Stack and Future Opportunities**

With a focus on innovation, OWNY is tagged under various domains like banking-as-a-service, fintech, crypto-web3, AI, and is well-positioned within the vibrant San Francisco Bay Area ecosystem. Optional features also include seamless crypto custody solutions through partnerships with providers like Coinbase Institutional.

If you're intrigued by the way OWNY is redefining financial management for businesses and investors alike, you can find more and even schedule a demo on their website: [OWNY.com](https://www.owny.com).

**Conclusion**

In a landscape where financial services often feel fragmented, OWNY shines as a comprehensive platform that brings together capital management, investor relations, and banking functionalities. With its roots in Y Combinator and continuous technological advancements, it’s a company worth watching.
